#### [Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/ "Tallinna Linnamuuseum") Tallinna Linnamuuseum Tallinna Linnamuuseum

![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/TLM-ENG-1.svg)
![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/KOK-en-1.svg)

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

## Visit the Bastion passages and the Museum of Carved Stone with an audio guide

**The Kiek in de Kök Fortifications Museum introduces the fascinating history of the underground passages in the Bastion passages and the Museum of Carved Stone. The NutiMuuseum audio guide [NUMU](http://augmentedtours.eu/en) allows visitors to learn about this fascinating place in Estonian, English, Russian and Finnish.**

![Bastionikäikude ja Raidkivimuuseumi audiogiidiga saab muuseumiga tutvuda ka üksikkülastaja](https://www.linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/MK_2675.jpg)

![Bastionikäikude ja Raidkivimuuseumi audiogiidiga saab muuseumiga tutvuda ka üksikkülastaja](https://www.linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/MK_2675.jpg)

Built in the 17th century, [**the Bastion passages**](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/kiek-de-kok/history-bastion-passages/) beneath the Inger and Swedish bastions are now part of [**the Kiek in de Kök Fortifications Museum**](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/kiek-de-kok/about-the-museum/). A professionally compiled audio guide will also help individual visitors find their way in the passages. You can download an audio guide to your smart device or use a phone provided by the museum.

NUMU, or NutiMuuseum, which is Estonian for “Smart Museum,” is an application that brings together the diverse content of Estonian museums and offers an opportunity to enter the stories of the museums through the visitor’s personal smart device.

The Bastion passages and the Museum of Carved Stone can still also be visited as part of a guided tour, which can be booked in advance at the scheduled times and also by special arrangement, and is conducted in Estonian as well as several foreign languages.

Read more on the **[visitor’s](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/kiek-de-kok/visitor-info/) information** page of the Museum or register [**HERE**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSddIWhlIS_5iR4oPKyIafED5fshj1QNu5Th_gLyQK9g69Q7LQ/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1)

**How the audio guide works**

Download the **[NUMU Nutimuuseum](http://augmentedtours.eu/en)** app onto your smart device from the App Store (iPhone) or Play Store (Android).  
Open the **[NUMU Nutimuuseum](http://augmentedtours.eu/en)** app and find the Kiek in de Kök Fortifications Museum’s audio guide in your preferred language.

**NB! To save time, we recommend downloading the audio guide before visiting the museum!**

Photograph: Meeli Küttim

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

## **Kiek in de Kök Fortification Museum tickets now on sale online Buy your ticket in advance!**

**Single tickets for the Kiek in de Kök Fortification Museum are on sale on the Piletilevi platform.**

[![](https://www.linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/kiek-in-de-kok-kaupokalda-com-oopanoraam-400x265.jpg)](https://www.linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/kiek-in-de-kok-kaupokalda-com-oopanoraam.jpg)

![](https://www.linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/kiek-in-de-kok-kaupokalda-com-oopanoraam-400x265.jpg)

The Kiek in de Kök Fortification Museum is a complex that stretches for more than 500 metres.

It includes four medieval towers: **Kiek in de Kök, Maiden Tower, Marstal Tower and Gate Tower**. The museum also includes the underground **bastion passages** constructed in the late 17th century and the **Carved Stone Museum** they house.

The museum showcases the city’s historic fortifications, the homes built by townspeople along the wall and in its towers built at the end of the 18th century, the artists who lived in one of the towers, and the famous café built in Maiden Tower in the 1980s. Tallinn’s longest wall gallery and towers offer sweeping views of the Old Town.

**Opening hours**

**October – April:  
Tue – Sun**11–18

**May – September:**  
**Mon – Sun** 11–18

[PUBLIC HOLIDAYS AND SHORTENED WORKING DAYS](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/tallinna-linnamuuseum-en/public_holidays/)

[BUY TICKETS HERE](https://store.piletilevi.ee/public/en/event/470907/purchase/sector/54053?sp=lm)

#### [Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/ "Tallinna Linnamuuseum") Tallinna Linnamuuseum Tallinna Linnamuuseum

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

#### Külgpaani navigatsioon

## Külgpaani navigatsioon

## Bastion passages

**Visit the Bastion passages and the Museum of Carved Stone with an [audio guide](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/cat-kiek-in-de-kok-en/the-bastion-passages-with-an-audio-guide/)!****The audio guide allows visitors to learn about this fascinating place in Estonian, English, Russian and Finnish.**

**NB! To save time, we recommend downloading the audio guide before visiting the museum!**

![ПОДЗЕМЕЛЬЯ БАСТИОНОВ](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Tunnels-3.png)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Bastionid-003.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Bastionid-004.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Raidkivi.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Raidkivimuuseum-bastionikäikudes.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Bastionitrepp.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/IMG_3326.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Tunnels-2.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/IMG_3320.jpg)
![](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Tunnels-5.png)
![tools](//linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/IMG_3330.jpg)

GUIDED TOURS HAVE TO BE BOOKED IN ADVANCE by e-mail: [\*protected email\*](javascript:;)

The tours are available in Estonian, English, Russian, and Finnish.  
Group size is limited to 25 persons.

The tour will take about 1 h 20 min

Please note that temperature in the passages is 7-10 °C throughout the year and we have to navigate some rather steep stairs, so please dress appropriately!  
Please note: We do not recommend taking children under the age of 7 to the Bastion passages guided tours!

## CARVED STONE MUSEUM

**The Carved Stone Museum, a section of the Bastion passages,** is open for individual visitors with the entrance in the Kiek in de Kök Tower.  
Guided tours, starting from the Kiek in de Kök tower, by subscription

[INFO and TICKETS](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/kiek-in-de-kok/guided-tours/)

The Carved Stone Museum part of the passages contains a display of decorative stone fragments from Tallinn, which have so far been kept hidden in repositories: portals, pillars, coats of arms with family signs and symbols, relief – decorated window jambs and tombstones from the 16th to 19th century.

The exhibition displaying more than two hundred carved stones is titled “The City of Ruins”. The atmospheric lighting and chambers dedicated to different themes play a crucial role in making the exhibition a coherent whole. In the museum, visitors can pass through the “Garden of Eden”, “Pillar Hall”, “Death Hall” and “Sun Hall”.

The casements next to the Vabaduse väljak (Freedom Square) were closed to the public and filled with water for decades ; now, powerful air conditioners provide an environment suitable for carved stones and acceptable for visitors – the temperature in the passages is between 10 to 12 degrees Celsius all year round.

## GUIDED TOURS

Guided tours are offered in **Estonian, English, Russian and Finnish** and last about **1 hour and 20 minute**s.

Group size is **up to 25 people.**

please book your visit in advance on  by e-mail at \*protected email\*

#### [Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/ "Tallinna Linnamuuseum") Tallinna Linnamuuseum Tallinna Linnamuuseum

![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/TLM-ENG-1.svg)
![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/KOK-en-1.svg)

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

## Exhibition in Kiek in de Kök **„History of Estonian Civil Defence“**

**In the Bastion passages of the Kiek in de Kök fortification museum, the Estonian Firefighting Museum and the Estonian Rescue Board present the history of Estonian civil defence over the last 100 years.**

This very timely topic provides a reason to look back at the history of civil defence in this region and draw parallels to the present day. The exhibition offers an overview starting from the 1930s and reaches into the present.

In modern civil protection, a key element is crisis preparedness, one aspect of which is seeking shelter in the event of danger. The Bastion Tunnels have played a significant role as shelters in history, especially considering the events of the 1944 war. The site itself provides an excellent environment to explore the theme and offers visitors a sense of stepping into history. The exhibition, consisting of photos, printed materials, objects, and audio and video materials, gives an overview of civil protection in Estonia from the 1930s to the present day.

The exhibition begins with a journey to the historical tunnels and ends underground, where visitors can watch an interview film created for this exhibition. The central figure of the film survived the March 1944 bombing of Tallinn and recalls the event through the memories of a 10-year-old child.

In addition to the historical overview, the exhibition also highlights the present day. As a part of the Rescue Board, the Estonian Firefighting Museum plays an important role in informing the public. The exhibition also covers contemporary topics such as safety alerts, sheltering, evacuation, and crisis management.

**The exhibition was created by Ivo Paulus, Kairi Priimets, Andres Muts, and Kadi Kübarsepp from the Estonian Firefighting Museum, with curator Kadi Kübarsepp and designer Mats Õun.**

**Special thanks to: Avitron OÜ, Sound & Vision, Pallitallaja OÜ.**

The exhibition is open at the Kiek in de Köki Fortifications Museum from **May 13, 2025, to May 31, 2026.**

results.content: Kes on meie nähtamatud lapsed? 13. detsember 2025 EESTI MUUSEUMIPOODIDE JÕULUTURG MUUMIRAHU. Elurõõm ja tarkus suurtükitornis. Näitus Kiek in de Köki ülakorrusel Neitsitorni kohvik: parimad vanalinnavaated ja pääs linnamüüri kaitsekäigule Kiek in de Köki kindlustustemuuseumi piletid nüüd müügil Piletilevis Osta pilet ette!
results.raw_content:
![](https://www.facebook.com/tr?id=764922485299108&ev=PageView&noscript=1)

#### [Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/ "Tallinna Linnamuuseum") Tallinna Linnamuuseum Tallinna Linnamuuseum

![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/nimi-et-1.svg)
![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/KOK-et.svg)

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

#### Külgpaani navigatsioon

## Külgpaani navigatsioon

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Muuseumide-joululaat-2024-64-285x225.jpg)

### 13. detsember 2025 **EESTI MUUSEUMIPOODIDE JÕULUTURG**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/Eia_Uus-285x225.jpg)

### 7. ja 26. nov. **vestlusõhtud näitusel “Muumirahu”:** Muumifilosoofiaga õnnelikuks? **Kes on meie nähtamatud lapsed?**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Muumiorg-285x225.jpg)

### **MUUMIRAHU. Elurõõm ja tarkus suurtükitornis. Näitus Kiek in de Köki ülakorrusel**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/neitsitorn-285x225.jpg)

### **Neitsitorni kohvik: parimad vanalinnavaated ja pääs linnamüüri kaitsekäigule**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/kiek-in-de-kok-kaupokalda-com-oopanoraam-285x225.jpg)

### **Kiek in de Köki kindlustustemuuseumi piletid nüüd müügil Piletilevis Osta pilet ette!**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/TTMF7741_1_pisipilt-285x225.jpg)

### Näitus bastionikäikudes **„Ligimese kaitseks“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/miniatuurraamatud-7-285x225.jpg)

### Näitus Kiek in de Köki fuajees **„Kääbusraamatud suurtükitornis“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/TASUTA-PUHAPAEV-400x315-285x225.jpg)

### **TASUTA MUUSEUMIPÜHAPÄEV** Tallinna Linnamuuseumi filiaalides

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Kiek-in-de-Koki-kahurikuulid-II-285x225.jpg)

### **Kiek in de Köki kahurikuulid pälvisid Kuldmuna 2025 turunduskonkursi tunnustuse**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/5_kiekindek6k2-285x225.jpg)

### Kiek in de Köki püsinäitus **„KAITSTUD LINN, KINDEL KANTS“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/neitsiateljee-1-e1665783125369-285x225.jpg)

### Neitsitorni püsinäitus **„NEITSITORN KUI KUNSTITEMPEL“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/neitsitorni-ateljee-285x225.png)

### Pea firmapidu, sünnipäev või pulm **ajaloolises Neitsitornis!**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Väino-Tamm_558x910-285x225.jpg)

### **Näitus „LÕPUTU KOHVIJOOMINE“** Kiek in de Köki kindlustustemuuseumis Lühikese jala väravatornis

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/QRCode-Tallinna-Linnamuuseumi-kulastuskogemus-1-285x225.png)

### **MUUSEUMIMULJED** Tallinna Linnamuuseum palub jagada oma külastuskogemust!

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Neitsitorni-seiklused-285x225.jpg)

### **TULE TUURILE oma seltskonnaga!** Vali siit sobiv teema ja lepime aja kokku!

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Neitsitorni80s-800-285x225.jpg)

### **TAASTATUD SISUSTUS** Neitsitorni kohviku hiilgeaegadest

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/MK_9154-285x225.jpg)

### **Tule vaata 1930. aastate Neitsitorni ja Taani kuninga aeda kujutavat maketti Neitsitornis**

![Henrik Olvi, vaade Kiek in de Kökile ja Neitsitorni kodule. 1956 (Tartu Kunstimuuseum)](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/kuninga-aed-olvi-56-ph-285x225.jpg)

### **Kuula Linnamuuseumi Taskuhäälingut!** Podcasti teemaks on Kiek in de Köki suurtükitorn

#### [Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/en/ "Tallinna Linnamuuseum") Tallinna Linnamuuseum Tallinna Linnamuuseum

![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/TLM-ENG-1.svg)
![Tallinna Linnamuuseum](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/KOK-en-1.svg)

#### Peamenüü

## Mobiili Peamenüü

#### Külgpaani navigatsioon

## Külgpaani navigatsioon

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Muumiorg-285x225.jpg)

### **New exhibition “MOOMIN PEACE. Joy and Wisdom”** in the Kiek in de Kök tower

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Muumirahu_FB_1920x1005-px-285x225.jpg)

### **MUUMIRAUHAA! Muumitalo on ajelehtinut Kiek in de Kökin torniin Tallinnan vanhassakaupungissa**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Muuseumide-joululaat-2024-64-285x225.jpg)

### December 13 **Christmas market of Estonian museum shops**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/kiek-in-de-kok-kaupokalda-com-oopanoraam-285x225.jpg)

### **Kiek in de Kök Fortification Museum tickets now on sale online Buy your ticket in advance!**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/TTMF7741_1_pisipilt-285x225.jpg)

### Exhibition in Kiek in de Kök **„History of Estonian Civil Defence“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/miniatuurraamatud-7-285x225.jpg)

### Exhibition 16.05–31.12.2025 **„Miniature books in the Kiek in de Kök Artillery Tower“**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/QRCode-Tallinna-Linnamuuseumi-kulastuskogemus-1-285x225.png)

### **Give us feedback!**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/here-they-fought-si-combatteva-qui-©-franconi-alessio-italy43-3-285x225.jpg)

### Alessio Franconi photographic exhibition at Kiek in de Kök tower: **“Here They Fought!”**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/5_kiekindek6k2-285x225.jpg)

### **The artillery tower Kiek in de Kök presents the history of the defense of Tallinn**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/TC_L_2023-285x225.png)

### Kiek in de Kök Fortification Museum **Recognized as Tripadvisor® 2023 Travelers’ Choice® Award Winner**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Väino-Tamm_558x910-285x225.jpg)

### **Exhibition „Endless Coffee Drinking“ At the Kiek in de Kök Fortress Museum, in the Gate Tower.**

![karoliinid käikudes](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Tunnels-3-285x225.png)

### **UNDERGROUND BASTION PASSAGES**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/FREE-SUNDAY-3-285x225.jpg)

### **Free Museum Sunday** in Tallinn City Museum

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Neitsitorni-seiklused-285x225.jpg)

### **COME ON TOUR with your friends!** Choose Your tour here

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg-1-285x225.png)

### **For people arriving from the war in Ukraine are visits to all branches of Tallinn City Museum free of charge**

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Neitsitorni80s-800-285x225.jpg)

### **RESTORED INTERIOR FROM 80s** The golden days of the Maiden Tower cafe

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/MK_9154-285x225.jpg)

### The Danish King’s Garden in the 1930´s

![](https://linnamuuseum.ee/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/MK_2701-285x225.jpg)

### Visit the Bastion passages and the Museum of Carved Stone with an audio guide
